_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

What kind of ascetic or brahmin doesn’t: Ascetics and brahmins who are not free of greed, hate, and delusion for sights known by the eye
Ascetics and brahmins who are not free of greed, hate, and delusion for sounds known by the ear
Ascetics and brahmins who are not free of greed, hate, and delusion for smells known by the nose
Ascetics and brahmins who are not free of greed, hate, and delusion for tastes known by the tongue
Ascetics and brahmins who are not free of greed, hate, and delusion for touches known by the body
Ascetics and brahmins who are not free of greed, hate, and delusion for thoughts known by the mind
What kind of ascetic or brahmin deserves: Ascetics and brahmins who are free of greed, hate, and delusion for sights known by the eye
Ascetics and brahmins who are free of greed, hate, and delusion for sounds known by the ear
Ascetics and brahmins who are free of greed, hate, and delusion for smells known by the nose
Ascetics and brahmins who are free of greed, hate, and delusion for tastes known by the tongue
Ascetics and brahmins who are free of greed, hate, and delusion for touches known by the body
Ascetics and brahmins who are free of greed, hate, and delusion for thoughts known by the mind
Reasons and evidence regarding those ven: Those venerables frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest
In such places, there are no sights known by the eye to see and enjoy
In such places, there are no sounds known by the ear to hear and enjoy
In such places, there are no odors known by the nose to smell and enjoy
In such places, there are no flavors known by the tongue to taste and enjoy
In such places, there are no touches known by the body to feel and enjoy
